description: AlchemyAPI offers 12 API functions as part of its text analysis service, each of which uses sophisticated natural language processing techniques to analyze your content and add high-level semantic information.

blocks.name: getCombinedDataFromHtml
blocks.description: Analyze an HTML with multiple text analysis operations.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: extract
args.info: Optional: Comma separated list of any of the following methods: authors, concepts (default), dates, doc-emotion, entities (default), feeds, keywords (default), pub-date, relations, typed-rels, doc-sentiment, taxonomy (default), title

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response

blocks.name: getCombinedDataFromUrl
blocks.description: Analyze an URL with multiple text analysis operations.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: url
args.info: Required: HTTP URL.

args.name: extract
args.info: Optional: Comma separated list of any of the following methods: authors, concepts (default), dates, doc-emotion, entities (default), feeds, keywords (default), pub-date, relations, typed-rels, doc-sentiment, taxonomy (default), title

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response

args.name: text
args.info: Required: File with Text content.

args.name: extract
args.info: Optional: Comma separated list of any of the following methods: authors, concepts (default), dates, doc-emotion, entities (default), feeds, keywords (default), pub-date, relations, typed-rels, doc-sentiment, taxonomy (default), title

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response

args.name: url

blocks.name: getRankedConceptsFromHtml
blocks.description: Extract concepts from text of an HTML document. Supported languages: English, Spanish

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: maxRetrieve
args.info: Optional: Maximum number of concepts to extract (default = 8, maximum = 50)

args.name: knowledgeGraph
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: linkedData
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: cquery
args.info: Optional: A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery. For more details visit http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/doc/alchemylanguage/visual_constraints.shtml. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: xpath
args.info: Optional: An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

blocks.description: Extract dates from an HTML content. Supported languages: English

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: anchorDate
args.info: Optional: The date to use as "today" when interpreting phrases in the text like "next tuesday.". Format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

blocks.name: getTargetedEmotionFromHtml
blocks.description: Detect emotions directed toward targeted phrases in an HTML document. Supported languages: English

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: targets
args.info: Required: Pipe delimited list of phrases. The service will analyze emotion directed toward each phrase that is found in the source text. Supports up to 20 phrases. Format: phrase1|phrase2|...

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response. Parameter is only used if indicated html or text parameter.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: cquery
args.info: Optional: A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery. For more details visit http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/doc/alchemylanguage/visual_constraints.shtml. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: xpath
args.info: Optional: An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: cquery

blocks.name: getTargetedEmotionFromText

args.name: text

args.name: targets

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

blocks.name: getRankedNamedEntitiesFromHtml
blocks.description: Extract entities from an HTML document. Supported languages: English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: maxRetrieve
args.info: Optional: Maximum number of entities to return (default = 50)

args.name: model
args.info: Optional: Specify a custom model ID here to override the default Alchemy entity extraction model. See README for more details.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: coreference
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to treat coreferences as separate entities (coreferences are resolved into detected entities by default).

args.name: disambiguate
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response.

args.name: knowledgeGraph
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: linkedData
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response.

args.name: quotations
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include quotations that are linked to detected entities.

args.name: emotion
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to analyze emotions associated with each detected entity. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: sentiment
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to analyze the sentiment towards each detected entity. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: structuredEntities
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to ignore structured entities, such as Quantity, EmailAddress, TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress.

args.name: cquery
args.info: Optional: A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery. For more details visit http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/doc/alchemylanguage/visual_constraints.shtml. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: xpath
args.info: Optional: An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

blocks.name: getRelationsFromHtml
blocks.description: Extract Subject-Action-Object relations from an HTML document. Supported languages: English, Spanish

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: maxRetrieve
args.info: Optional: Maximum number of entities to return (default = 50, maximum = 100).

args.name: keywords
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to identify keywords in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: entities
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to identify named entities in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: requireEntities
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to restrict results to relations that contain at least one named entity.

args.name: coreference
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to treat coreferences as separate entities (coreferences are resolved into detected entities by default).

args.name: disambiguate
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response.

args.name: knowledgeGraph
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: linkedData
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response.

args.name: sentiment
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to analyze the sentiment towards each result. This incurs an additional transaction charge.

args.name: sentimentExcludeEntities
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to exclude named entity text from sentiment analysis. For exapmle, do not analyze "New" in "New York".

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: cquery
args.info: Optional: A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery. For more details visit http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/doc/alchemylanguage/visual_constraints.shtml. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: xpath
args.info: Optional: An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

blocks.name: getTypedRelationsFromHtml
blocks.description: Use custom models to identify typed relations between detected entities in HTML document. Source text in Typed Relations calls is truncated to 5 KB. Typed relations identify different types of connections between detected entities. For example, the entities "Oscar" and "Leonardo DiCaprio" might be linked by an "awardedTo" relation. To tailor results for your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: model
args.info: Optional: The unique alphanumeric identifier for your custom model. You can also choose from the following public models: en-news: trained on English news content (default); es-news: trained on Spanish news content; ar-news: trained on Arabic news content.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

To tailor results for your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio.

blocks.name: getTargetedSentimentFromHtml
blocks.description: Analyze sentiment for targeted phrases in an HTML document. Supported languages: Arabic, English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: targets
args.info: Required: Pipe delimited list of phrases. The service will return sentiment information for each phrase that is found in the source text. Supports up to 20 phrases. Format: phrase1|phrase2|...

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

blocks.name: getTextFromHtml
blocks.description: Extract primary text content from an HTML document. Cleaned page text is obtained by default in other HTML and URL functions. You can view the results of page cleaning in responses from most of the other methods by passing showSourceText=1.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: html
args.info: Required: File with HTML content.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: Input here will appear as the url value in the response.

args.name: showSourceText
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response.

args.name: extractLinks
args.info: Optional: Set this to 1 to include hyperlinks in the extracted text.

args.name: useMetadata
args.info: Optional: Set this to 0 to ignore description information in webpage metadata.

args.name: cquery
args.info: Optional: A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery. For more details visit http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/doc/alchemylanguage/visual_constraints.shtml. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: xpath
args.info: Optional: An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

args.name: sourceText
args.info: Optional: How to obtain the source text from the webpage. For more details see README. Parameter is only used if indicated html or url parameter.

blocks.name: getModels
blocks.description: This endpoint allow you to manage custom models that are deployed to your AlchemyAPI service instance. With an Advanced pricing plan and access to Watson Knowledge Studio, you can create your own custom model that specializes in understanding entities and relations that are unique to your domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

blocks.name: deleteSingleModel
blocks.description: Deletes a custom model that was deployed to your AlchemyAPI service instance from Watson Knowledge Studio.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from AlchemyAPI.

args.name: modelId
args.info: Required: The unique identifier for the model that you want to delete.
